Research Experience

  • 2025 - Present
    Graduate Research Assistant
    Purkayastha Lab for Health Innovation (PLHI), Indiana University Indianapolis
    • Advised by Prof. Saptarshi Purkayastha
    • Embeddings are Noise Eliminators - Ablation Studies to Show What is Eliminated in Foundation Models
    • Multimodal Model for Activity Recognition in Parkinson's and Non-Parkinson's Individuals Using Biological Sensors
    • CrossSeizure - Learning Generalizable Representations for Cross-Dataset Epileptic Seizure Classification
  • 2024
    Summer Research Assistant
    Pembroke College, University of Cambridge, UK
    • Advised by Dr. Bridget Bannerman & Prof. Jorge Júlvez
    • Investigated role of Mycobacterium tuberculosis and macrophage cells in lung cancer development
    • Employed genome-scale metabolic models using COBRApy for Flux Balance Analysis
    • Identified potential drug targets by comparing essential reactions in Mtb-infected versus normal macrophage cells
  • 2019
    Undergraduate Research Assistant
    Jacobs School of Engineering, UC San Diego
    • Advised by Prof. Maurício de Oliveira & Prof. Jack Silberman
    • Integrated electronic components to design and fabricate circuit, coupling with Raspberry Pi to build hardware foundation for autonomous vehicle
    • Installed and configured TensorFlow, OpenCV, and Donkey library, reducing failure rate from 25% to 3% after 20 test runs
    • Collected and processed 35,000 image data points and implemented deep learning algorithms to train autonomous driving models on GPU clusters
    • Enabled vehicle to successfully complete 10 indoor and 6 outdoor laps consecutively in full autopilot mode
    • Applied convolutional neural networks (CNN) on CIFAR-100 dataset to train object detection model, achieving at least 85% accuracy
  • 2017 - 2019
    Undergraduate Research Assistant
    Statistical Visual Computing Lab (SVCL), UC San Diego
    • Advised by Prof. Nuno Vasconcelos
    • Developed deep learning-based plankton image labeling and retrieval system
    • Implemented data augmentation using Keras and TensorFlow, expanding dataset 2x
    • Applied transfer learning using ResNet-50, improving classification accuracy from 65% to 90%
    • Accelerated plankton image labeling by factor of 10, processing 1 billion images
  • 2017 - 2018
    Undergraduate Research Assistant
    Xu Research Group, UC San Diego
    • Advised by Prof. Sheng Xu
    • Fabricated conformal ultrasonic probe using stretchable circuit patterning
    • Simulated ultrasound beam pattern using MATLAB and TAC_GUI toolbox
    • Contributed to publication in Nature Biomedical Engineering
  • 2018
    Control System Project Lead
    Jacobs School of Engineering, UC San Diego
    • Supervised by Executive Director Alex Phan, Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
    • Designed three-level vending machine using SolidWorks, incorporating 3D-printed delivery trays, spiral ejectors, product selection buttons, and laser-cut plywood and acrylic
    • Programmed vending machine's control algorithm using NI myDAQ and LabVIEW, achieving instantaneous response
    • Awarded Most Reliable Device and earned LabVIEW Associate Developer Certificate from National Instruments
